sense.def:
To find something
pomeni odkriti, videti ali izvedeti, kje je tisto, kar iščemo.

seg.quote: She found a crack in one of the tea-cups.
She looked up to find Tony standing there.

sense.def:
To find something
pomeni, da se nam posreči dobiti nekaj, kar potrebujemo ali želimo.

seg.quote: I had not yet found the answer.

gramGrp.pos:
REPORT VB
or
VB
with
OBJ
and
COMPLEMENT

sense.def:
To find that something is the case
pomeni zavedeti se ali spoznati, da je nekaj tako, kot je.

seg.quote: When I got back, I found that the reading lamp would not work.
I don't find that funny at all.
Others may find them of value.

sense.def:
To find oneself doing something
pomeni nekaj narediti, čeprav nismo nameravali.

To be found in a particular place
pomeni, da je tisto na nekem kraju.

seg.quote: Four different species of lungfish are found in Africa.

sense.def:
To find one's way somewhere
pomeni nekam priti, tako da izberemo pravo pot.

To find the time to do something
pomeni, da nam uspe nekaj narediti, čeprav smo zelo zaposleni.

seg.quote: How do you find time to write these books?

sense.def:
Kadar sodišče ali porota
finds a person guilty or not guilty
, se odloči, ali je oseba kriva ali nedolžna.

seg.quote: He was found guilty of murder.

sense.def:
Če tisto, kar je bilo odkrito, imenujemo
a find
, se nam zdi zanimivo, dobro ali uporabno.

seg.quote: Among the finds so far are pottery and jewellery.
Liz Pym, who plays the heroine, is a real find.

sense.def:
To find something out
pomeni nekaj izvedeti, pogosto namenoma in tako, da se potrudimo.

seg.quote: I found out the train times.

sense.def:
To find someone out
pomeni odkriti, da je tisti človek počel nekaj nepoštenega.
